articles.title: Haeju Children's Camp Face-lifted
articles.content:
Haeju Children's Camp Face-lifted
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The appearance of the Haeju Children's Camp standing at the foot of Mt. Suyang in South Hwanghae Province has undergone a radical change. 
					 There sprang up a bath-cum-sauna house, a table-tennis hall, an amusement hall and other cultural and welfare facilities and an open-air theatre.
					
					 The existing houses for campers and main building, etc. have been renovated to match the new buildings.
					
					 Good arrangements are now being made to receive the first group of campers this year.

articles.title: Minju Joson: DPRK Will Bolster Up Its War Deterrent
articles.content:
Minju Joson: DPRK Will Bolster Up Its War Deterrent
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will bolster up its war deterrent under the uplifted banner of Songun as long as the U.S. military threat and provocations against it persist.
					 Minju Joson Sunday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 All parts of south Korea reek of gunpowder due to the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. imperialist trigger-happy forces together with the south Korean puppet troops. Consequently, the situation on the Korean Peninsula is inching close to a touch-and-go situation.
					
					 This clearly indicates that though the U.S. is loud-mouthed about "dialogue," it remains unchanged in its wild ambition to stifle the DPRK by force of arms.
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. imperialist war-like forces to strain the situation on the peninsula and mount a surprise preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK in a bid to bring it under its control.
					
					 The on-going joint war maneuvers are of very dangerous, aggressive and provocative nature in their program, feature and scale. They are exercises for a nuclear war against the DPRK with a preemptive nuclear strike being their main operation. 
					
					 It has become clearer that the U.S. is only seeking to unleash a nuclear war to stifle the DPRK by force of arms, far from defusing its nuclear threat despite Pyongyang's sincere efforts to denuclearize the peninsula. The DPRK is, therefore, left with no option but to bolster up its war deterrent. 
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK regard its sovereignty and dignity as dearer than their own lives. They will mobilize all the military potentials built so far and mercilessly wipe out the aggressors, should they intrude into its inviolable air, land and seas even 0.001 mm.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop running amuck, properly understanding the DPRK's will for strong counteraction and tremendous power.

articles.title: S. Korean Forces Urged to Improve Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
S. Korean Forces Urged to Improve Inter-Korean Relations 
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The permanent representative of the Scientific Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea on March 5 urged the conservative ruling forces to roll back their anti-DPRK confrontation policy and opt for improving the inter-Korean relations.
					 He deplored that the present regime strictly banned the meeting of scientists in the south and the north, barring them from having any academic exchange, adding that the authorities disallowed the working contact with the north last year.
					
					 What the authorities should do, first of all, for improving the inter-Korean relations is to respect the spirit of the south-north joint declarations, make efforts to wipe out the distrust between the south and the north and abolish the "National Security Law", he urged.
					
					 Expressing the hope that scientists in the south and the north would be able to meet with each other this year, he called upon all the non-governmental organizations for reunification movement to unite as one and wage a more dynamic struggle to achieve reunification, the desire of the nation.

articles.title: S. Korean Trade Unions Call out Actions for Reunification
articles.content:
S. Korean Trade Unions Call out Actions for Reunification
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Hwang Su Yong, chairman of the reunification committee of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, at a news conference held on March 9 called for launching positive actions for successfully holding the north-south reunification event.
					 The present "government" is blocking cooperation and exchange with the north and bedeviling the inter-Korean relations, persistently pursuing an anti-reunification policy, but it can never quell the desire of the people for peaceful reunification, he declared.
					
					 It is the firm faith of the workers to preserve and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, he noted, expressing their will to make positive efforts for bringing the reunification event to a success.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Costa Rica
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Costa Rica
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The work of General Secretary Kim Jong Il "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" was brought out in booklet by the Costa Rican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea on March 8. 
					 The work published on January 29, Juche 92 (2003) clarifies the idea that the Songun-based revolutionary line of the Workers' Party of Korea, Songun politics is an effective political mode of our era which carried forward and developed the idea and line of President Kim Il Sung on attaching importance to arms and a scientific revolutionary line, a political mode most correctly reflecting the requirements of the times and the revolution. It also clarifies the validity, advantages and great vitality of the Songun politics.
